name: PixiTracker Module
summary: Learn about .PIXIMOD files and view a list of programs that open them.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download

content: PixiTracker is a free tool that amateur audio enthusiasts primarily use. They often use the program to create musical sketches, chiptunes, and sound experiments.
The program comes with PIXIMOD files but allows you to create and save your own songs as PIXIMOD files. To create a PIXIMOD file, lick the three-line hamburger menu icon and then select Save Song As.

description: A PIXIMOD file is a song created by Nightradio PixiTracker, a music tracker program. It contains song data, such as notes and sounds, in the PixiTracker Module (PIXIMOD) format that the program loads to play synthesized music. PixiTracker users typically save songs as PIXIMOD files and then convert them to more widely supported formats, such as .XM or .WAV files.

instructions: You can open a PIXIMOD file with PixiTracker in Windows. To open a PIXIMOD file, click the three-line hamburger menu icon and then select Load Song.

PixiTracker can convert PIXIMOD files to the Fasttracker 2 Extended Module (.XM) and WAVE Audio (.WAV) formats. To convert a PIXIMOD file, click the three-line hamburger menu icon and then select Export/Import.
